title: Obama and Pelosi are 'watching and waiting' Joe Biden, 'not sure what to do'
content: Former president Barack Obama and ex-speaker Nancy Pelosi are watching and waiting for President Joe Biden to reach a decision on whether to opt out of the presidential bid or not, CNN reported after Biden referred to Kamala Harris as Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky as President Putin -- in his 'big boy' press conference last night; concluding Nato summit.
summary: Former president Barack Obama and ex-speaker Nancy Pelosi are watching and waiting for President Joe Biden to reach a decision on whether to opt out of the presidential bid or not, CNN reported after Biden referred to Kamala Harris as Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky as President Putin -- in his 'big boy' press conference last night; concluding Nato summit.

title: Melania may attend party convention next week after Donald Trump's ex-wife said this
content: If Melania attends the convention, it will be the second big surprise from Trump camp in the run up to the election -- the first being Barron Trump's political debut at father's rally in Florida on Wednesday. This campaign, Melania maintained a low profile and also suggested that she won't be a full time first lady if Trump becomes the president. She would like to divide her time between Washington in the White House and in New York with her son Barron Trump -- who will be soon going to a university.
summary: If Melania attends the convention, it will be the second big surprise from Trump camp in the run up to the election -- the first being Barron Trump's political debut at father's rally in Florida on Wednesday. This campaign, Melania maintained a low profile and also suggested that she won't be a full time first lady if Trump becomes the president. She would like to divide her time between Washington in the White House and in New York with her son Barron Trump -- who will be soon going to a university.

title: Nepal’s PM Pushpa Kamal Dahal 'Prachanda' loses vote of confidence in parliament, forced to step down
British police arrest man on suspicion of crossbow murders of 3 women near London
content: Kyle Clifford was arrested by Hertfordshire Police for killing Carol Hunt and her daughters Hannah and Louise with a crossbow in Bushey. Clifford, in serious condition, was found in Lavender Hill Cemetery after a manhunt. The victims are family of John Hunt, a BBC 5 Live commentator. No shots were fired during the incident.
summary: Kyle Clifford was arrested by Hertfordshire Police for killing Carol Hunt and her daughters Hannah and Louise with a crossbow in Bushey. Clifford, in serious condition, was found in Lavender Hill Cemetery after a manhunt. The victims are family of John Hunt, a BBC 5 Live commentator. No shots were fired during the incident.

title: Indian Techie Siddhant Vitthal Patil who drowned in US had texted mother hours before tragedy, says relative
content: Indian techie Siddhant Vitthal Patil, 26, is presumed drowned in Glacier National Park. He texted his mother before the incident. Siddhant's parents, Priti and Vitthal, who retired from Maharashtra's irrigation department in May, are in shock and unable to speak. Leaders from Maharashtra, including Sharad Pawar and Devendra Fadnavis, have requested the government's help. Union minister Murlidhar Mohol, from Pune, is in touch with external affairs minister S Jaishankar for updates on the search operation.
summary: Indian techie Siddhant Vitthal Patil, 26, is presumed drowned in Glacier National Park. He texted his mother before the incident. Siddhant's parents, Priti and Vitthal, who retired from Maharashtra's irrigation department in May, are in shock and unable to speak. Leaders from Maharashtra, including Sharad Pawar and Devendra Fadnavis, have requested the government's help. Union minister Murlidhar Mohol, from Pune, is in touch with external affairs minister S Jaishankar for updates on the search operation.

title: American tourist dies after a sudden illness during an excursion on Sicily's Mount Etna
content: An American tourist, 55, died on Sicily's Mount Etna. Despite efforts from rescuers and an air ambulance, revival attempts failed. Ferrara advised caution against high temperatures, humidity, and altitude risks. Italy had a red weather alert in several cities, while Mount Etna, Europe's highest active volcano, saw increased activity the prior week.
summary: An American tourist, 55, died on Sicily's Mount Etna. Despite efforts from rescuers and an air ambulance, revival attempts failed. Ferrara advised caution against high temperatures, humidity, and altitude risks. Italy had a red weather alert in several cities, while Mount Etna, Europe's highest active volcano, saw increased activity the prior week.

title: 4 migrants die while attempting to cross the English Channel from northern France
content: Four migrants have died while attempting to cross the English Channel on an inflatable boat from France to the UK, French authorities said Friday. The migrants' vessel capsized and punctured off the coast of Boulogne-sur-Mer in northern France. Sixty-three people were rescued by the French coast guard. French authorities issued a statement concerning the incident. They noted that migrants risk drowning while trying to cross the busy English Channel, often aboard crowded and unseaworthy boats.
summary: Four migrants have died while attempting to cross the English Channel on an inflatable boat from France to the UK, French authorities said Friday. The migrants' vessel capsized and punctured off the coast of Boulogne-sur-Mer in northern France. Sixty-three people were rescued by the French coast guard. French authorities issued a statement concerning the incident. They noted that migrants risk drowning while trying to cross the busy English Channel, often aboard crowded and unseaworthy boats.

title: Plane with 59 passengers skids off runway in Nepal, no injuries reported
content: A Buddha Air plane with 59 people veered off the runway at Gautam Buddha Airport, Lumbini province, on Thursday night. No injuries were reported, and all were safely evacuated. The aircraft became stuck in the mud, prompting a temporary airport closure. Buddha Air operates domestic and international flights from Nepal to India.
summary: A Buddha Air plane with 59 people veered off the runway at Gautam Buddha Airport, Lumbini province, on Thursday night. No injuries were reported, and all were safely evacuated. The aircraft became stuck in the mud, prompting a temporary airport closure. Buddha Air operates domestic and international flights from Nepal to India.

title: 'Unborn human being': Arizona abortion rights advocates sue GOP-led committee over pamphlet language
content: An Arizona abortion rights group is suing a GOP-led committee over language referring to a fetus as an 'unborn human being' in a voter pamphlet. The group argues for the use of 'fetus' instead. Similar initiatives are being proposed in other states. Stay informed on this developing story.
summary: An Arizona abortion rights group is suing a GOP-led committee over language referring to a fetus as an 'unborn human being' in a voter pamphlet. The group argues for the use of 'fetus' instead. Similar initiatives are being proposed in other states. Stay informed on this developing story.

title: India-origin man arrested for 'groping' 12 people including minors in Canada
content: An Indian-origin man, 25, was arrested in Moncton, New Brunswick after groping multiple individuals at a public water park, including at least twelve victims, some under 16. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) apprehended the man at the scene, and he was later released on bail. He is scheduled to appear in Moncton Provincial Court on October 24. The RCMP is continuing the investigation and encourages anyone affected to come forward, as noted by Sgt. Sylvette Hebert.
summary: An Indian-origin man, 25, was arrested in Moncton, New Brunswick after groping multiple individuals at a public water park, including at least twelve victims, some under 16. The Royal Canadian Mounted Police (RCMP) apprehended the man at the scene, and he was later released on bail. He is scheduled to appear in Moncton Provincial Court on October 24. The RCMP is continuing the investigation and encourages anyone affected to come forward, as noted by Sgt. Sylvette Hebert.

title: Laugh a day for health benefits: Japan passes bill to reduce risk of heart disease
content: Japan’s Yamagata prefecture has enacted a unique ordinance encouraging citizens to laugh daily for health benefits, based on Yamagata University research linking laughter to reduce heart disease risk and live a little longer life. The ordinance designates the 8th of each month as “Laughing Day” to promote wellness through humor. However, opposition lawmakers, including the Japanese Communist Party, argue that the law violates human rights and fails to address broader socio-economic issues like job instability and rising living costs.
summary: Japan’s Yamagata prefecture has enacted a unique ordinance encouraging citizens to laugh daily for health benefits, based on Yamagata University research linking laughter to reduce heart disease risk and live a little longer life. The ordinance designates the 8th of each month as “Laughing Day” to promote wellness through humor. However, opposition lawmakers, including the Japanese Communist Party, argue that the law violates human rights and fails to address broader socio-economic issues like job instability and rising living costs.

title: SpaceX launches 20 Starlink satellites after delay, boosting direct-to-cell network
content: SpaceX launched 20 Starlink satellites on July 11, including 13 with direct-to-cell capabilities. The Falcon 9 rocket, launched from Vandenberg Space Force Base, successfully landed its first stage on a droneship. This marks SpaceX's 69th Falcon 9 mission in 2024, bringing the Starlink network to over 6,150 operational satellites, with more direct-to-cell units expected soon.
summary: SpaceX launched 20 Starlink satellites on July 11, including 13 with direct-to-cell capabilities. The Falcon 9 rocket, launched from Vandenberg Space Force Base, successfully landed its first stage on a droneship. This marks SpaceX's 69th Falcon 9 mission in 2024, bringing the Starlink network to over 6,150 operational satellites, with more direct-to-cell units expected soon.

title: Nato backs US President Joe Biden after 'slip of tongue' at summit
content: NATO defended US President Joe Biden after he mistakenly referred to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "President Putin" during a press conference at the NATO summit in Washington. The slip was quickly corrected, but reporters raised concerns. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and French President Emmanuel Macron both defended Biden, calling it a "slip of the tongue" and emphasising Biden’s clarity on issues. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Polish President Andrzej Duda also expressed confidence in Biden’s leadership.
summary: NATO defended US President Joe Biden after he mistakenly referred to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "President Putin" during a press conference at the NATO summit in Washington. The slip was quickly corrected, but reporters raised concerns. German Chancellor Olaf Scholz and French President Emmanuel Macron both defended Biden, calling it a "slip of the tongue" and emphasising Biden’s clarity on issues. UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer and Polish President Andrzej Duda also expressed confidence in Biden’s leadership.

title: 'For the sake of American democracy': Who are 17 Democrats asking Biden to drop out of presidency race?
content: House Intelligence Committee's top Democrat, Jim Himes, advises President Biden to halt his 2024 re-election campaign amidst concerns over his legacy. Despite calls from 15 House Democrats, Biden has the backing of party leaders Jeffries and Schumer.
summary: House Intelligence Committee's top Democrat, Jim Himes, advises President Biden to halt his 2024 re-election campaign amidst concerns over his legacy. Despite calls from 15 House Democrats, Biden has the backing of party leaders Jeffries and Schumer.

title: Pew Survey: Trump leads Biden by 4 points in new poll amid concerns over President's mental acuity
content: A Pew Research Centre poll shows former President Trump leading President Biden by 4 points among registered voters, with 50% support to Biden's 47%. Only 24% of Americans view Biden as "mentally sharp," down from 54% in 2021, while 58% see Trump as sharp. Despite Biden being seen as more honest, Trump is perceived as more "mean-spirited."
summary: A Pew Research Centre poll shows former President Trump leading President Biden by 4 points among registered voters, with 50% support to Biden's 47%. Only 24% of Americans view Biden as "mentally sharp," down from 54% in 2021, while 58% see Trump as sharp. Despite Biden being seen as more honest, Trump is perceived as more "mean-spirited."

title: 'Bet on Russia as a reliable partner is not a good bet': US warns India
content: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan warned India that relying on Russia as a "reliable partner" is a poor strategic move, noting that Russia will prioritise its relationship with China over India in any future disputes. Sullivan, addressing questions about Prime Minister Modi's recent visit to Moscow, emphasized that while India’s long-standing ties with Russia persist, the US is focused on strengthening democratic partnerships globally. Modi’s visit to Russia was part of the 22nd India-Russia annual summit, amid the Ukraine conflict.
summary: US National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan warned India that relying on Russia as a "reliable partner" is a poor strategic move, noting that Russia will prioritise its relationship with China over India in any future disputes. Sullivan, addressing questions about Prime Minister Modi's recent visit to Moscow, emphasized that while India’s long-standing ties with Russia persist, the US is focused on strengthening democratic partnerships globally. Modi’s visit to Russia was part of the 22nd India-Russia annual summit, amid the Ukraine conflict.

title: 'If my doctors tell...': What Biden said on undergoing neurological examination
content: President Biden expressed willingness to undergo a neurological exam if recommended by his doctors, amid concerns about his mental fitness. He emphasised his doctors' competence and noted frustration over the focus on his age. Biden reaffirmed his re-election bid, despite Democratic pressure to withdraw, citing his extensive travel and decision-making as proof of his capabilities.
summary: President Biden expressed willingness to undergo a neurological exam if recommended by his doctors, amid concerns about his mental fitness. He emphasised his doctors' competence and noted frustration over the focus on his age. Biden reaffirmed his re-election bid, despite Democratic pressure to withdraw, citing his extensive travel and decision-making as proof of his capabilities.

title: Watch: Biden refers to Kamala Harris as 'vice president Trump' in solo press conference
content: ​​The president said, "Look, I wouldn't have picked vice president Trump to be vice president [if] I think she's not qualified to be president," confusing Harris with former president, Donald Trump. Earlier, during a Nato event, before the press conference, Biden mistakenly even referred to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "President Putin". "And now I want to hand it over to the president of Ukraine, who has as much courage as he has determination, ladies and gentlemen, President Putin," Biden said at the Nato summit in Washington on July 10.
summary: ​​The president said, "Look, I wouldn't have picked vice president Trump to be vice president [if] I think she's not qualified to be president," confusing Harris with former president, Donald Trump. Earlier, during a Nato event,  before the press conference, Biden mistakenly even referred to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy as "President Putin". "And now I want to hand it over to the president of Ukraine, who has as much courage as he has determination, ladies and gentlemen, President Putin," Biden said at the Nato summit in Washington on July 10.

title: Prince Harry receives ESPY award amid controversy
content: Prince Harry received the prestigious Pat Tillman honour at the ESPY Awards amidst initial criticism from Pat Tillman's mother, Mary. Despite controversy, Harry acknowledged Mary Tillman's advocacy for her son's legacy. Honored for founding the Invictus Games, he emphasized the award's significance to wounded service members. The event also celebrated A'ja Wilson and JuJu Watkins among other athletes.
summary: Prince Harry received the prestigious Pat Tillman honour at the ESPY Awards amidst initial criticism from Pat Tillman's mother, Mary. Despite controversy, Harry acknowledged Mary Tillman's advocacy for her son's legacy. Honored for founding the Invictus Games, he emphasized the award's significance to wounded service members. The event also celebrated A'ja Wilson and JuJu Watkins among other athletes.

title: US to resume sending shipments of 500-pound bombs to Israel
content: The United States is resuming the shipment of 500-pound bombs to Israel after concerns about the use of 2,000-pound munitions in populated areas. President Biden confirmed that the larger bombs will not be sent. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has led to a significant civilian death toll and ongoing tensions.
summary: The United States is resuming the shipment of 500-pound bombs to Israel after concerns about the use of 2,000-pound munitions in populated areas. President Biden confirmed that the larger bombs will not be sent. The conflict between Israel and Hamas has led to a significant civilian death toll and ongoing tensions.
